sentence.Network_en: "Cut her out of your will," urged his nephew.
sentence.Network_cn: “把她从你的遗嘱中删去，”他的侄子催促道。

sentence.Network_en: She has a nephew who is just ten years of age.
Last month a shopkeeper's nephew was shot dead.
sentence.Network_cn: 上个月一名店主的侄子被枪杀了。

list.abs: and he had forty sons and thirty nephews , that rode on threescoreand ten ass colts : and he judged Israel eight years .他有四十个儿子，三十个孙子，骑着七十匹驴驹。押顿作以色列的士师八年。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French neveu, from Latin nepos 'grandson, nephew', from an Indo-European root shared by Dutch neef and German Neffe

entry.def: Someone's nephew is the son of their sister or brother.

example.ex: I am planning a 25th birthday party for my nephew.
example.tran: 我在为侄子筹划他25岁的生日聚会。

means.word_mean: 1. a son of your brother or sister

Sentence.sentence: Most of them remind me of the stuff my nephew brings home from the kindergarten.
Even his nephew can draw as well as Picasso

jushi.english: My father's nephews are my cousins.
jushi.chinese: 我父亲的侄子是我的堂兄。

jushi.english: He is a nephew of the governor.
